persName.name: Na Auda, concubine of Raimund dels Alamans
Raimunda, mother of Flor del Mas

note.p: HGL Vol 7 Col. 333 Item c. pet. Floris, uxoris quondam Alfarici, dixit se audivisse dici quod G. Alfaricus, avus istius predicti Alfarici, fuit extumuiatus de cimiterio et combustus pro heresi. Item dixit se vidisse G. Alfaricum patrem predicti Alfarici faiditum tempore comitis M. F. et in guerra vicecomitis,et fuit postea condempnatus de heresi. Item dixit quod vidit G. Fortem patrem predicte Floris faiditum tempore comitis M. F. et postea in guerra vicecomitis.

HGL Vol 7 Col. 383 Contra petitionem Floris, uxoris quondam Alfarici, etc, dixit quod vidit Guillelmum Alfaricum, patrem istius Alfarici qui vivit, captum et condemnatum de heresi per fratrem Ferrarium apud Cannas et incarceratum apud Carcassonam, dicens quod ipsem et testis fuit captus tune cum dicto G. Alfarici et quibusdam aliis. Item dixit, quod vidit faiditum dictum G. Alfarici ante guerram vicecomitis et in guerra vicecomitis, et audivit dici et credit quod dictus G. Alfarici fuit faiditus tempore comitis Montisfortis, quia comes Montisfortis vel alii pro ipso tenebant terram dicti G. Alfarici sicut de aliis faiditis. Item dixit se vidisse faiditum G. Fortem patrem dicte Flors tempore comitis Montisfortis et in guerra vicecomitis

person.occupation: Cabrigas = goat farmer from Occitan cabrit?

person.note: Possibly same as Guilhelma Fauressa? Also, seems to have been married to two men.
Guilhem is rarely mentioned on 609, to the point where one could think it a notarial error for Bernard or Peire.
Possibly wife of the above Arnald Faure?
dominus de Bello Forti et de Monte Mauro
After his death, Godalh's wife Guilhelma married Raimund Picrelh (cf. MS609-0000).
Married to Arnald Godalh, then Raimund Picrelh.
From Bello Castro, modern location unknown.
Possibly Mas Bosc. First name uncertain.
Possibly the same Boni Mancip Maurand of Toulouse?
Sometimes referred to as Jordan Palazi
Palaisin may be bastard of the clan

This Raimund Sanci is mentioned in Doat as maritus of Na Gauza, but may be one of the other extant Raimund Sancis, either the heretic or of Mirepoix
Name origin : estuary or brackish water
